list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His words contrast with his actions.

list_definition.definition: to compare so as to show differences

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Contrast fresh and frozen vegetables and you’ll find the fresh ones taste better.

list_definition.definition: difference(s) in things or people that are compared

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The contrast between their attitudes is very marked.

list_definition.definition: a thing or person that shows a marked difference (to another)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She’s a complete contrast to her sister.

list_ex_of_english: This too was in marked contrast to the conduct of planning before the devaluation.
Older physicians, in contrast, probably looked forward to returning to their established practices.
Note that this is in contrast to most traditional fault modeling approaches where the fault is represented as an additive or a multiplicative time-dependent quantity.
The verbal gerund, by contrast, can combine with adverbs, auxiliaries, ordinary objects, and common-case subjects.
In contrast, lithium or imipramine reduced depression scores but did not improve learning.
In contrast, when eco-forestry is unsubsidized, groups meeting their own set-up costs, the returns per hectare are still positive but very modest.
They contrast with syntactic representations, which are structured in terms of lexical heads and grammatical functions or relations.
Ordinary forgetting, by contrast, is neither selective nor intelligent.
